entry_requirements_raw.Foundation: Foundation in Traditional Chinese Medicine or Foundation in Science with CGPA 2.50 (Science stream); Foundation in other fields with a minimum of CGPA 2.50 and above including credits in any 2 Science subjects and Mathematics at SPM level (Non Science stream).
entry_requirements_raw.SACE/WACE: ATAR is >65 OR Degree holder with accreditation in any field OR Other equivalent qualifications recognized by the Malaysian Government (Science stream); ATAR is >65 AND Credit in any 2 Science subjects and Mathematics at SPM (Non Science stream).

entry_requirements_raw.SPM: Science Stream Students: Minimum 5 Credits, including any 2 subjects in Mathematics/ Physics/ Chemistry/ Biology; Arts Stream Students: Minimum 5 Credits, including Mathematics and Science.
entry_requirements_raw.UEC: Science Stream Students: Minimum grade B in 4 subjects, including any 2 subjects in Mathematics/ Physics/ Chemistry / Biology; Arts Stream Students: Minimum grade B in 4 subjects, including Mathematics and students are required to sit for Chinese Medicine Placement Test before any enrolment into Foundation in Traditional Chinese Medicine.

entry_requirements_raw.Degree: -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.75 or equivalent; OR, -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.50 and not meeting CGPA of 2.75, can be accepted subject to rigorous internal assessment; OR, -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.00 and not meeting CGPA of 2.50, can be accepted subject to a minimum of 5 years working experience in a relevant field and rigorous internal assessment..

Degree.text: -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.75 or equivalent; OR, -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.50 and not meeting CGPA of 2.75, can be accepted subject to rigorous internal assessment; OR, -A Bachelors degree in the field or related fields with a minimum CGPA of 2.00 and not meeting CGPA of 2.50, can be accepted subject to a minimum of 5 years working experience in a relevant field and rigorous internal assessment..

entry_requirements_raw.Degree:
A Bachelors degree (Level 6, MQF) in a related field or its equivalent with a CGPA below 2.50 can be accepted subject to a minimum of 5 years of work experience in the relevant field..  A Bachelors degree (Level 6, MQF) in a related field with a minimum CGPA of 2.75 or its equivalent qualification as accepted by the HEP Senate; or
A Bachelors degree (Level 6, MQF) in a related field or its equivalent with at least a CGPA of 2.50 but not achieving CGPA 2.75 can be accepted subject to a systematic internal assessment

course_content.core:
Coursework (12 credits) Advanced Communication Theory (4 credits)
Quantitative Research Methods for Communication (4 credits)
Qualitative Research Methods for Communication (4 credits) Advanced Communication Theory (4 credits) Quantitative Research Methods for Communication (4 credits) Qualitative Research Methods for Communication (4 credits) Dissertation (28 credits) Students are required to conduct a research in a communication-related field under the supervision of an academic staff and write a dissertation of 40,000 words.
